message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I think you'll find it's a great opportunity for you to acquire something that will bring significant value to your business. I'm willing to offer it to you for $14000.

I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $13500. I believe it's a fair price considering the product's value. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit on this deal.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I can see that you're serious about acquiring this product, and I'm willing to meet you halfway. However, I need to ensure I get a fair price for it. I'm willing to come down to $13750. This is the lowest I can go, and I believe it's still a great deal for both of us.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to make a serious offer of $13000. I believe it's a fair price considering the product's value, and I'm willing to walk away if it's not acceptable to you.

Bob, I can see you're serious about getting a good deal, and I appreciate your transparency. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $13000. I'm willing to compromise and meet you at $13250. This is my final concession, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

I understand you've made a final concession, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you at $13000, and I'm confident that it's a fair price for both of us. I'm not willing to go any higher, so I hope we can agree on this price.

Bob, I appreciate your persistence, but I'm not willing to sell at $13000. I'm starting to think that we're not going to meet in the middle. This is my last offer, and I hope you can meet me at this price.

This is my last offer, and I hope you can meet me at this price.

I understand you're making a last-ditch effort, but I'm still not willing to go above $12800. I'm willing to walk away from the deal if it's not acceptable to you. I'm sticking to my previous offer of $12800.
